Why Neutrino Experiments ?
Why Neutrino Experiments ?

page.title:
Which Neutrino Measurements ?
Which Neutrino Measurements ?
page.normal_text:
Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 3
Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 3
page.enlisting:
• We don’t know exactly what we need to do to pin down the physics responsible for neutrino masses, but there is a broad consensus that the first steps for the accelerator-based neutrino program are: – Measure the unknown mixing angle q13 (is it non-zero) ? – Determine the pattern of neutrino masses (mass hierarchy) – Find or constrain CP violation in the neutrino sector • The less clear longer-term steps may involve finding more neutrino surprises, will probably involve guidance from other experimental results (LHC, CLV, neutrinoless bb …), & will almost certainly involve precision neutrino parameter measurements: – Do any of the parameters have special values ? – Suggestive relationships between parameters ? – Is 3 flavor mixing the whole story ? • We don’t know exactly what we need to do to pin
• We don’t know exactly what we need to do to pin
down the physics responsible for neutrino masses, but there is a broad consensus that the first steps for the accelerator-based neutrino program are: – Measure the unknown mixing angle q13 (is it non-zero) ? – Determine the pattern of neutrino masses (mass hierarchy) – Find or constrain CP violation in the neutrino sector

page.title:
A New Type of Neutrino Beam
A New Type of Neutrino Beam
page.normal_text:
O(1021) muon decays / year
O(1021) muon decays / year O ( 1 0 2 1 )
m u o n
d e c a y s
/
y e a r

Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 4
Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 4
page.enlisting:
● A Neutrino Factory would provide a new type of neutrino beam, made from muon decays (c.f. charged pion decays for conventional neutrino beams. ● Since muons live 100 longer than charged pions, to be efficient a linear muon decay channel would have to be tens of km long, hence: ● A Neutrino Factory would provide a new type of neutrino beam, made from muon decays (c.f. charged pion decays for conventional neutrino beams.

page.enlisting:
• Proton Source – Beam power  4MW – E  few GeV – Short bunches ( 3ns) • Target, capture & decay – Create p, decay into m  • Bunching & Phase Rotation – Capture into bunches – Reduce DE • Cooling (cost effective but not mandatory) – Use Ionization Cooling to reduce transverse emittance to fit within an accelerator • Proton Source

page.title:
Key Experimental Signature
Key Experimental Signature
page.normal_text:
Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 7
Steve Geer High Intensity Proton Accelerators Fermilab 19 October 2009 7
page.enlisting:
• Measuring the transitions ne  nm is crucial for the future neutrino oscillation program. • With a conventional neutrino beam this means measuring nm → ne oscillations, and hence ne appearance. With a NF we can measure ne → nm oscillations & hence ne appearance → very low backgrounds • Backgrounds to the detection of a wrong-sign muon are expected to be at the 10-4 level → background-free ne → nm oscillations with probabilities of O(10-4) can be measured ! • Measuring the transitions ne  nm is crucial for the future neutrino oscillation program. • With a conventional neutrino beam this means measuring nm → ne oscillations, and hence ne appearance. With a NF we can measure ne → nm oscillations & hence ne appearance → very low backgrounds
